x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: GreenPulse would enable schools, offices, and communities to monitor their rainwater harvesting systems, track water saved, and visualize their reforestation impact through real-time dashboards. With measurable metrics—like liters of water conserved, trees planted, and CO₂ offset—the solution promotes accountability and encourages participation in sustainability initiatives.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Urbanization and deforestation have led to water scarcity and loss of green cover. Many organizations and communities lack visibility into how effectively they conserve water or contribute to reforestation efforts.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: GreenPulse – Smart Rainwater Harvesting & Reforestation Tracker
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ESG Management and Reporting for sustainability metrics

Flow Designer and IntegrationHub to automate IoT sensor data ingestion

Performance Analytics for insights and progress tracking

Mobile App Builder for on-the-go community reporting

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

IoT sensors for water level tracking, satellite or GIS data for tree coverage analysis, and integration with external environmental APIs.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Ensuring sensor accuracy, encouraging user participation, and managing integration across different environmental data sources.
